Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel right next to San Marco square”
Reviews.Author: Alex D
Reviews.Content: Great hotel within 10min walk to San Marco square and 5min walk to main water taxi stop. Rooms were very clean and a bit bigger then I had expected. Breakfast was average. I would defiantly recommended staying here if you are looking for a mid range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location during carnival”
Reviews.Author: kangarooInAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during the carnival. This time of the year is packed with tourists, so we arrived very early in the morning from Verona to the train station. From the vaporetto stop, it is only a few minutes walk to the hotel, with no bridges to climb. Therefore, it is excellent and feasible in the mornings and evenings. It can be though to walk your luggage during carnival.. Its location is obviously excellent only 5 minutes walk to St. Marco's square. The room was of average size, with medium-comoftable bed. However, we asked to move to another room and the staff nicely changed our rooms to a better one. The wifi is not free. The breakfast is average. During carnival the hotel's price was quite expensive, but considering the location it is good. I would recommend to stay on the island, since the city is jam packed and you can easily walk to the square where everything is happening. Getting from Mestre is not such an easy task, considering also the (possibly) bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: suspend6
Reviews.Content: Renovated and very clean hotel right near St Marks Square. Jump off the water bus and it is literally a five minute walk to this venue. From the front you can hardly even tell it is a hotel. Small frontage, unobtrusive, but very clean, and it even has an elevator (one person at a time though). Some rooms have windows opening on to small canals. We have stayed here on a couple of occasions, and would definitely stay again if in Venice. Some great local restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: MatthiasVlassembrouc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this spot. La Locandiera is very good located in Venice city centre. San Marco and all other interesting spots are just 5 minutes walking away. The hotel wasn't easy to find, but i think this is quite normal, as this was our first visit at Venice. Maybe they could place some marks on the streets to easy your search? Rooms are cozy, spacious and clean. We did not miss anything. One serious problem i found was the isolation of the rooms: you could easily hear everything through the walls and doors. So, if you have noisy neighbours (which we had the second night), you could easily follow their discussions. Breakfast was included, which is interesting, because Italians don't have the habit to take a breakfast. The breakfast was basic, but still good enough. Overal, we were happy with our stay at La Locandiera and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely find”
Reviews.Author: jackie95
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and we thought it was brilliant and good value - for Venice! Tucked away in a little courtyard (quite hard to find - we walked past it at first!), but only 5 minutes from St Marks and 10 minutes from the Railto, so perfectly located. 5 minutes walk from San Zaccaria vaparetto stop. We had a lovely room on the top floor (No 32). It was huge with a massive bed, nicely decorated and had windows on 2 sides. Lovely bathroom with a waterfall shower. No bath but that didn't worry us. The breakfast room was right outside our room, but we didnt find it too noisy - the church bells were a lot louder and earlier! The staff were friendly and helpful. My only criticism was that the only mirror was in the bathroom - could have done with one in the room, and the toliet could have done with some bleach down it!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: masontitus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, and we had no complaints. The hotel was nicely decorated and had everything we could want. The AC worked great, a nice bed, wifi available. The location was great also, a quick walk over to San Marco and plenty of shopping and restaurants all around. I would recommend this place to anyone and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but missing a bar/restaurant on-site”
Reviews.Author: Hewlster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights this October. It's in a brilliant location, literally a stones throw from San Marco and therefore very easy to find in the maze of streets. The staff were great. Very friendly and suggested we attend one of the Vivaldi concerts which was well worthwhile. They also were happy to recommend restaurants, tours etc if wanted. The room was nice and clean, with aircon (which we didn't expect to use in October, but it was very welcome). The breakfast was basic but plentiful. Taking into consideration the cost of hotels in Venice, this was very good value for money and would not hesitate to recommend staying there, providing you are looking for a base and not a full hotel experience. We really did miss a bar to come back to and end the evening with a night-cap.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Convenient Location â€“ We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: LuvDaSun222
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from the San Zaccaria boat stop. We arrived by train and took a water taxi to the San Zaccaria boat stop. Booking a water taxi online is about the same price as paying at the train station the difference being that a pre-paid water taxi is tough to find as they donâ€™t go out of their way to identify themselves. We didnâ€™t want to negotiate the public water transport after first arriving in Venice. It was about 70 euros for the water taxi. Using the directions from the website we found the hotel fairly easily. It helped that we looked at the exterior photos of the hotel before going to Venice as itâ€™s easy to walk by the front entrance. The hotel is in a really convenient location. Located about 3-4 blocks from Piazza San Marco, itâ€™s about a 5 minute walk to the square. Itâ€™s located on a small square with residences and a small church. There are plenty of restaurants and shops within a few minutes of the hotel. Itâ€™s a small hotel with something like 12 or 15 rooms. After searching many websites and comparing hotels I booked the hotelâ€™s â€œquadâ€� room. Located on the 3rd Â½ floor the room was composed of two adjoining hotel rooms. The TVâ€™s are tiny and there are only 5 channels (one is CNN). The quad is at the back of the hotel over a small canal and a neighboring hotel. The air conditioning was excellent and kept the room very cool on the hot late June days. There was a bathroom in each room. One included only a tub and the other only a shower. Our rooms were on the top floor and down the hall from the breakfast area. So in the morning it could get a little noisy when people arrived for breakfast. We placed hand towels at the bottom of the door and this help cut down on the early morning noise. The breakfast consisted of some cereals, breads, juice and coffee. It was enough to give you something to fill tummies before heading out. They also provided us with electronic mosquito repellent devices. We used them the first two days but found that with the windows shut there were no issues with bugs or pests. The beds were comfortable. Housekeeping kept the room very clean. Afternoon attendant (from Croatia) was very helpful in helping us understand the area and steer us in the right direction. The staff was helpful and attentive. The hotel was very quiet. It was a very pleasant stay and weâ€™d stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Brooke W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Locandiera for two nights during a short stay in Venice. It can be tricky to find, but with the map provided by the staff and on the website, it's not too bad. It is close to St. Mark's Square and is situated in a quiet courtyard. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially in providing simple directions to get to specific restaurants and attractions. Our room was comfortable, and had a nice window opening out to a canal below. The bathroom was great, with a waterfall shower head. I was impressed at the cleanliness of the hotel and the rooms. The hotel offers an hour of free internet access, but if you need more, its about 3 Euro for extra time. The breakfast was good, being a typical European style breakfast. The breakfast room is a bit small, and if it is crowded, I can imagine it being uncomfortable. But, we didn't experience any problems. I would recommend this hotel for couples or small groups looking for a good, central location for staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Syrah-Viognier
Reviews.Content: We've stayed two nights in La Locandiera on July. It's a very nice hotel in a good location, close to St. Mark's Square but far enough so that the crowds don't bother you at all. The room was spacious and comfortable. Although it's equipped with A/C we didn't use it. Unfortunately the hotel didn't provide Wi-Fi for free. The breakfast buffet was half decent. No hot meals, only croissants, cereal, yogurt etc. However, what annoyed us more than the not so rich breakfast, was the noise coming from the breakfast room which is close to every room on that floor, making it very hard to sleep past 8 o clock in the morning! We could hear every plate and glass clanging, even as the staff set the tables. There's always someone at the reception desk but at night the front door is closed and you have to buzz yourself in.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel and will be back”
Reviews.Author: mackgrey
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is only 8 mins walk from St Marks square and within a short distance from all the other sights. The hotel is situated in a quiet square and is small, decorated to a high standard and very comfortable. The staff are all very friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... air conditioning was not adequate”
Reviews.Author: griftsno1capper
Reviews.Content: The location was good but the air conditioning was not enough to keep the room cool. The staff was very helpful. and quite pleasant. I would stay again except in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rcktman
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is hard to beat - minutes from Piazza San Marco. It's on a small square tucked away from the tourists, so it's very quiet. The rooms are clean, well kept, and in my experience pretty large. When I return to Venice, unless I look for a Grand Canal splurge, I won't look at other hotels if La Locandiera has rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved the hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: BigTex21
Reviews.Content: Hotel facility, location and staff were excellent. Hotel is in a quiet plaza, just blocks from the busy St Marks square. Facility was clean and well maintained. Staff made the trip special. Marina spoke perfect English and helped make our trip special by recommending tours and even setting up a gondola trip for us just hours before we headed out. We stayed there for 3 nights and would stay again next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: Ceeaybee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and loved it. Easy to find with map sent by e-mail and only 5 minutes from the San Zaccaria stop where the Alilaguna water bus drops you off from the airport. This is also the waterbus stop where you can travel just about anywhere in Venice and only 5 minutes from St. Mark`s Square and 10 minutes to Rialto.Stayed in room 21 on second floor which was at back of hotel overlooking a small canal.Very comfortable bed and clean,modern facilities.Friendly and helpful staff.Relaxed feel to hotel.Comprehensive street map including waterbus routes provided on arrival.We took up the offer of the free taxi ride to Murano but there was no high pressure selling when we arrived at the glass factory. No mosquitos and weather was very warm.Venice was busy but not overcrowded so a goodctime to go there.Our only gripe was the cost of restaurant food where you are charged high prices but then they add cover charges,a few euros for some hard rolls and then 12% service charge.There are places where you can buy slices of pizza or rolls for about 4 euros. But the hotel was great and we would definately return there and recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: ifeelyourpain77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on the smaller side, nothing grand but clean and nice. I think for venice, this was a cheaper hotel but still good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for a True Venetian Experience”
Reviews.Author: aevegan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nestled away in a prime location just outside of the San Marco area. As with any boutique hotel I was a little unsure of what to expect heading into it (although I felt comfortable given the great reviews on TA). But this hotel was great. The location couldn't be better, it's exactly where we wanted to be. Walking distance to everything we needed and easy access to the public transit. There's a bunch of restaurants right around the corner (make sure to ask the front desk for a recommendation of something good but not touristy to avoid getting ripped off). There were quite a few nearby. The rooms were bigger than I expected and very clean. They are simple but it was perfect for what we wanted. It felt like a true "Venetian" experience. We were able to sit on the window sill and look right out into the waterway. One word of caution, there's no AC, so you may keep the window open to stay cool. Not a problem, but good to know in advance. I did get bit by a few mosquitoes because we had the window open all night, a bug coil or something would've have helped and I think they actually have them we just didn't ask. The breakfast was great a lot of breads, pastries, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, juices, coffee, and fruit. It made a great way to start the day. The hotel offered a free tour to a glass making shop which was pretty cool. It was a nice boat ride too! All in all, we had a great stay. Venice was a little crowded for my taste but this hotel made the stay pleasant and the price was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: AmyMYK
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely, small hotel. The room was very spacious and comfortable for three. Situated between San Marco and the Rialto Bridge, so very central.

Reviews.Title: “OUtstanding value: location, service, quality of accommodations”
Reviews.Author: pam_kukla
Reviews.Content: A short 5 minute walk from San Marco but in a non-tourist neighborhood, La Locandiera far exceeded our expectations on all counts: quality of the room, helpful, knowledgeable, friendly staff, great location and ambiance. We 2 seasoned, sophisticated travelers with high expectations would not hesitate to send everyone we know to this place --- and what a great value.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy here!”
Reviews.Author: graily
Reviews.Content: La Locandiera is one of those wonderful small Italian hotels that feels very homey and welcoming. The price is very reasonable compared to other Venice hotels and the rooms are surprisingly spacious. The hotel is immaculate. We stayed in room #14 overlooking a quiet square. We booked a double room that had a comfortable king bed, an armoire with small safe, a dresser and desk. In addition there was a day bed in the room which was handy. The bathroom was very modern with a walk-in shower and towel warmer. If you prefer a walk-in shower to a bath, be sure to request that at the time of making your reservation. A discount is given for staying 3 or more nights. Breakfast was a very nice European style buffet with croissants and rolls, yogurt, fruit, cheese, cereal, boiled eggs and beverages. Marina and Giulia at the front desk were very friendly and helpful giving directions and anything else we needed. Wi-fi is available for a small fee. We felt that Venice is worth at least 4 nights as there is so much to see and do. The hotel is a quick 5 minute walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop and walking distance to everything in Venice. The hotel will e-mail you a very good map to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, nice and simple, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cmzi
Reviews.Content: A couple from Slovenia (30-35 years), visiting for few days in the beginning of August 2010. Stayed for three days in La Locandiera in Venice for a romance/relaxing trip. As everything is expensive in Venice, this hotel turned out to be a real nice choice for the normal price. It is very simple to find (contrarily to some other opinions - I guess some people are used only to perpendicular streets) - just follow the excellent hotel map from the ferry stop San Zaccaria at San Marco. Pros: 1. Location, location, location. In the very centre, but unbelievingly quiet. Our room faced a small square (Campo San Giovanni Nuovo) to the south near the (former?) church, and other rooms face the canal. Either way you can sleep well. Also, in Venice you will walk a lot (even with ferry hopping), so getting quickly back to hotel from anywhere during the day or after a good dinner is always appreciated. 2. Helpful staff. Always there (24h), all speaking Italian/good English (+other), willing to chat and to give useful information. It was possible to reschedule our trip for a few days just before the arrival without any financial consequences. Indeed they offer a free (one-way!) tour to Murano, and it is also possible to make agreements for the gondola trip (yes, *expensive*, but if you are on a romance trip...just do it and forget the ticking Euros :-). 3. Simple but nice self-serving breakfast. I guess the majority of the hotels offer quite the same regarding the other reviews. The breakfast room on the ground floor is nice and has windows on the canal. 4. Lift. Not many hotels in this price range offer this. 5. Very nice, big and clean bathroom, no leaking or damaged walls. Cons: 1. Have to think hard to find any...maybe just if some other guests would occupy the room just opposite our door, we could hear their doors opening and banging in our room as there are no additional doors inside the room, but I suppose this is normal in all hotels. Overall, very satisfied and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “La Locandiera was awesome! Friendly staff, nice accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: pgluke
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice via the Alilaguna lines. It was a very short walk to the La Locaniera, tucked away in a quiet corner, but just off of a busy street. Marina and Giulia were very helpful and spoke English. The hotel has a lift which was very handy. Breakfast was nice; the typical European breakfast, however, they had boiled eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt and cereal. We had to leave Venice on the 8:25am boat and Marina accommodated us by allowing us to have our breakfast at 7:30. Normally, it's between 8-10. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is centrally located, great value and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel,helpful staff,good location”
Reviews.Author: sin81
Reviews.Content: We just got back this sunday from our trip to Italy. We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel.I was quite amazed to see such a clean and relatively large room,when compared to more expensive hotels in rome and florence. The room is neat and tastefully decorated. The staff was very helpful.There was some problem signing up on the common internet computer,so the reception person actually let us use his computer to print our our boarding passes.They are very nice and polite. The hotel is located just beyond St Mark's square.Very close to everything,water taxi,restaurants etc. Overall,quite a lovely experience and we would definitely return to this hotel. yes - only thing is they have a bath tub with no shower curtain or door,so you kinda have to take a shower very cautiously,else the entire bathroom gets wet.this was painful.everything was great otherwise

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed in a quiet square but still close to San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: Annie808
Reviews.Content: After a Vaporetto trip along the length of the Grand Canal to San Zaccariah and a five minute walk we found our hotel tucked away in a quiet square. What an oasis of calm after the hustle and bustle of Venice ! Quick and easy check in and our room was quiet and cool and adequately appointed. Breakfast was in a room overlooking a quiet back canal but made you feel like you were right on the water. The location is key here as it is a short walk to San Marco and the Grand Canal. Ideally placed to explore all of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pitsstoptravelclub
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was very easy to find,just a 5 min walk from San Zaccaria vaporetto stop (which took about 30 mins to reach from Santa Lucia train station by vaporetto) using only the little map printed from the website. La Locandiera is located in a quiet little square called Campo San Giovanni Novo,when you enter the square look carefully for the entrance on the right it's really just like a house doorway and easily missed,if the door is shut just ring the bell and reception will open it ( reception is staffed 24 hrs). We stayed in room 32 which is on the top floor (there is a small lift),with double bed,single bed,bathroom with walk in shower and 2 windows facing onto the square although the square is a walk through once the wooden shutters are closed it was very quiet.There was also a mini bar and tiny safe (only big enough for passports etc). Breakfast was served in a little room overlooking a canal .A basic breakfast of coffee tea 1 roll + 1 croissant per person, cereal, fruit,yoghurts. Boiled eggs were added to breakfast only on Saturday + Sunday mornings! All in all a good comfortable, very clean,friendly hotel in great location 5 min walk to San Marco square but far enough to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and secluded, away from the crowds, yet in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: akitchen
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and comfortable; the staff was friendly and always willing to help. Not expensive, yet in the heart of the city, five minutes from St Mark's. Access to the vaporetto (S. Zaccaria) is a mere five minute walk, and good restaurants are just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “La Locandiera Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: galaxy24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the Hotel is very well located; within walking distance of all the main attractions. We had rooms overlooking a canal. The breakfast consisted of cereals, eggs, cheese, fruit, yogurts, croissants, rolls, dried toast and hot and cold drinks. The rooms were very clean, the only negative point would be that there wasn't a mirror in one of the bedrooms (but that could easily be added) and all our children used the shower in our bathroom as they had a bath in theirs! Would definitely recommend this Hotel, in fact we are considering booking it for my parents wedding anniversary. Another plus point for this Hotel is the free trip to Murano Island to visit the glass factory. We went on a private boat which we all thoroughly enjoyed! The glass factory was well worth visiting and then we looked aroung the Island which was very enjoyable. Thoroughly enjoyed our break in Venice, although very expensive to eat out. Recommend choosing restaurants carefully as we had some very bad and quite rude service in some restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PeterNsw
Reviews.Content: Very good choice. Not too expensive (given Venice) and in an excellent location. Staff fantastic. Room was very large with great atmosphere - felt vey comfortable there. The only place we would ever stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy during our stay”
Reviews.Author: ItalyHMTrip
Reviews.Content: The hotel room and bathroom were very spacious and the decor was simple but nice. The rooms are not very sound-proof. The rooms were clean and the staff was decently friendly. The location was pretty good, close to San Marco and the water bus stop. Breakfast was nice - typical Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgain008
Reviews.Content: Great location, five minutes from Piazza San Marco and the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, great rates, clean, quiet and comfortable room, decent breakfast, friendly staff, what more can you ask for? This was our first visit to Venice, we stayed here 3 nights. If we return - certainly a possibility - we would just come right back here. The website map and directions for finding the hotel are accurate, but the sign on the building is discreet and easily missed, so look around when you arrive at the small campo where the hotel is located. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Get a good map before you try to find this place in the dark!”
Reviews.Author: kcbenz34
Reviews.Content: Venice is a maze, and a random printed out map isn't going to get the job done! This hotel is in a square and looks tiny from the outside, but it was a great place to stay. The staff was fantastic, and a free trip to Murano is included! The breakfast is average, but the rooms and bathrooms are roomy and very nice. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: OzziMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We spent a week and enjoyed staying at the hotel. It has a very good location close to Venice's center, however staying on a quiet street, close to vaporetto. Staff could explain everything and give recommendations. Our room was good, quiet and clean. Breakfast was good, however depending on the amount of people staying in the hotel. I am not going to visit Venice again, however if that happens I'd try to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: ford720
Reviews.Content: When we first got off the water bus (near San Marco), frankly this hotel is not the easiest to find. Passerby didnt seem to know the exact location of the hotel. Well, we cant blame them as there are so many small hotels in the island of Venice. It should be less than 8 mins walk from the water bus station (if you get the right directions). Hotel is located in a rather quiet alley. In a way, it is good because hotels by the big canal could be noisy. Hotel staff are warm and friendly! It is about 5 mins walk to San Marco; so it is quite close to the action. Room is clean and spacious. Comes with free simple breakfast. No free wireless internet though. Overall, we are pretty satisifed.!

Reviews.Title: “Staying Again”
Reviews.Author: LEXUSGAL
Reviews.Content: We will be back in Venice in August and we decided to stay here again since it was clear, quiet, room and bath very nice, and the location was excellent. This time we will not have 2 pieces of luggage each tugging around the paths of Venice even though we now know how to find the hotel. The price is very reasonable according to Venice standards and is a real fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay for our extended family”
Reviews.Author: cymric94
Reviews.Content: We were traveling in a group of 5 - our college age daughter, my husband and I, and my parents. We had two rooms - both were quiet and comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent - an easy walk to St. Marks but it was so much quieter. We liked being able to escape from the crowds. We also enjoyed walking in to the neighborhoods behind the hotel which were much less crowded. The staff at the hotel were helpful and it was nice to leave our key at the desk so that any member of our group could come back at any time. The breakfast was good and my parents loved the little elevator. We would definitely stay again if back in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ATravelingVirginian
Reviews.Content: La Locandiera is on a quiet square just a few steps from St. Marks. We found the room clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtuba
Reviews.Content: After walking ourselves silly each day in Venice, this was a nice hotel to come home to. My wife and I agreed that this was one of the better hotels we've stayed in W. Europe. The room was very clean and more spacious than average. The location is only five or so minutes walk to the Piazza San Marco but in a quiet but beautiful area. The staff is very helpful and were happy to provide a great map and give directions. Breakfast is included and quite good: juice, coffee, bread, cereal, hard-boiled eggs etc. Nothing bad to say. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay!”
Reviews.Author: Weezieyat
Reviews.Content: We had 10 family members in 5 rooms at the La Locondiera. It's been awile since we went and I wanted to be sure to write this review. Like my title, the three days we spent in Venice were Magical. The La Locondiera and Marina were part of that experience. The best accommodations: close to St. Mark's Square and a short walk to the water taxis. We were extremely tired when we arrived and very hungry. Marina walked us over to a wonderful restaurant and had them take care of our needs. The personal care was just great. The hotel was very clean and neat. Breakfast was great, nice and light, since all we did the rest of the day in Venice was eat! We would definitely stay here again. I think it's one of Venice's best kept secrets. Especially the price!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, great location; highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Liz0815
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Locandiera 3 nights. We had a bit of difficulty finding the hotel, but only because we arrived on the last day of Carnivale and the streets were jam packed with revelers. Once there, however, we felt like we were at home. The staff were exceptionally helpful with both directions and restaurant recommendations. If we come back to Venice in the future we would definitely stay at La Locandiera, and we will recommend this hotel to any of our friends who are looking for a clean and convenient hotel that will not break their budget.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurenxx
Reviews.Content: We were three female friends staying at La Locandiera in February 2009, for 3 nights. Our room was a spacious triple room with views over the court yard. It had everything we needed, it was very clean and the bathroom was a good size. The staff were extremley helpful and spoke good english. Marina suggested somewhere to eat near the Hotel, which turned out to be a great find. Good prices and excellent food. The Hotel was staffed 24 hours and there was always someone there to let you in. The breakfast was good it was cold but lots of it. We were very central with just 5 minutes to St Marks Square, and about the same to the water front. We went during carnival weekend and it was very crowded, but spectacular!! We would definately book again if we return to Venice. Just one tip, If you visit Harry's bar, the drinks are very expensive. We had a belini each, in a small glass, and they were 15 Euros each.They were excellent though!! Wine is about a third of a glass full, and coke is around 4 euros for a can and a glass.. You need to shop around away from the tourist area for food and drink at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Texasgirl68
Reviews.Content: After staying at many hotels across Europe and in Italy in particular, we found this to be a very good hotel. The room we had (for 3 people) was spacious and clean with comfortable beds. The bathroom was modern, yet still felt Italian. The breakfast was simple, yet offered enough to be filling. Additionally, the hotel workers were very helpful with every question we had regarding Venice and with our needs. We felt well taken care of during our stay and would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend La Locandiera!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: fulmar63
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and again we were not disappointed. It is a delightful place and ideal for a short break. The hotel is in a wonderfully quiet location even though it is minutes from St Marks Square. The room was spacious, spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds and a hot towel rail meant lovely warm towels! We appreciated the small safe facility in the room for personal items and the mini bar! The staff were very friendly and pleasant as we found last time and we felt very at ease to come and go as we pleased Like other guests it is quite hard to find the hotel on your first visit .. an overhanging sign would be very helpful. We definitely recommend this little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at La Locandiera”
Reviews.Author: tribilinMiami
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at La Locandiera. The hotel was very easy to find following the instructions that were given to us after our confirmation . Our room faced a small piazza, it was very clean and comfortable for the 3 of us. We left the windows open all day and night and the temperature stayed cool, however mosquitos were a problem. A quick call to the front desk took care of it with a mosquito repellent. Marina who worked at the front desk was very helpful and informative with restaurants etc. I will stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with modern bathrooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: Pitch_the
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in the great city of Venice. Superb location being 5 minute walk from Mark's Square and from the ferries. Had courtyard facing room and was quiet at night. Room was large with high ceilings and great aircon. Bathroom was also large and modern. Great breakfast included each day (bread, croissants, cereal, egg, ham). Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again if return to Venice. If looking for a restaurant , would highly recommend Al Paradiso near Rialto bridge (ferry to it or 10-15 min walk).

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: walker567
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel very well situated near St Marks square. From the outside it looks very simple, opening onto a quiet square. The rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was good. Bathrooms were lovely. There is a lift. The staff speak very good english and were very helpful. We had two rooms, one double and one triple. All in all, it is a very good choice for Venice and I would certainly like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good small hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ra1irc
Reviews.Content: This a quiet and immaculate little hotel on a small square only a few minutes away from St. Mark's, good restaurants, and shops. My wife, daughter and I recently stayed in a triple room facing the square. The room was very nicely decorated and comfortable. Marina, and all employees with whom we spoke, were remarkably helpful and delightful. A relaxing refuge, priced well, less than two minutes from a water taxi drop, and a very easy walk from the Vaporetta stop at San Zaccaria. We recommend La Locandiera as a very good small hotel in beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “La Locandiera the best”
Reviews.Author: Lemster
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, great hotel. Would definitely return. Stayed three nights with my husband and college age daughter (May 2008). Chose this hotel after a close friend recommended it and then checked reviews on TripAdvisor. The location canâ€™t be beat, just minutes by foot to St. Markâ€™s Square, but very, very quiet. Our room was a very large triple facing the front of the hotel and the small quiet square. Both room and bathroom were very well appointed and immaculate. Again no face cloth so bring your own if you use one. The staff were pleasant and welcoming. We did not have the opportunity to ask for assistance, so I cannot speak to that. Breakfast was served on the second floor two mornings and on the ground floor the final morning. The other three hotels we stayed in Italy served a buffet breakfast; however, here each guest was served only one croissant. Other breakfast fare was served as well, which, although modest, was satisfying. They have wireless internet available which was broken when we were there. They made a computer available to guests for free, which was nice. If you follow the directions on the hotel website you shouldnâ€™t have a problem. When you exit the San Zaccaria stop and face away from the water, calle delle Rasse will be one of the narrow openings between the buildings. Youâ€™ll have to go to the opening and look up on the wall to see the name of the street. Once identified, just follow the directions. Also, on arrival at the Santa Lucia train station you can buy your vaporetto (water bus) ticket inside at the newsstand to avoid the long lines outside at the vaporetto stop. Once in the city get your tickets at a tabacchi. The ticket lines at the stops, especially near St. Markâ€™s Square, can be long. See my other reviews of Hotel Apollo, Rome and Hotel Caravaggio, Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely”
Reviews.Author: ThreesCompanyOtown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, quiet and simply lovely. The staff, especially Marina, were wonderfully helpful. Our room was large, with a view of the square, although next time we would ask for a canal view, clean and air conditioned. My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed in Venice for two nights. Upon arrival, we knew we had not planned enough time to explore this beautiful city. Our hotel was easy to find and conveniently located near St. Mark's Square and the Grand Canal. Restaurants, shopping, museums, sights and sounds are amazing. We would go back today, if possible. We took a 4 hour walking tour which was definitely a highlight. We were able to see so much of Venice that we otherwise would not have known about, learn about it's incredible history, and toured St. Mark's without having to wait in line. Also, take a water taxi ride, visit the market early in morning, stop for a quick grappa or espresso, shop, eat and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samcock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights and we were both impressed by the quality of this small but charming Hotel. It is extremely well located for sightseeing and was much easier to find (thanks to their website map) than we expected. We went on the free trip (one way) to Murano and the glass blowing factory and not withstanding the expected sales pitch we thouroughly enjoyed the experience, the island was delightful. Many thanks to all the staff who added to our holiday with there pleasant and hospitable manner, always ready to advise and help. All in all a splendid vacation in a wonderous city at this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Venice and La Locandiera”
Reviews.Author: nora17
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay in this hotel for the bank holiday weekend 24-26th May based on the reviews from tripadvisor through Venere.com and we absolutely loved our stay. The hotel is located in a very quiet area in Venice but it is very close to everything at the same time! About 5-10 minutes walk to San Marco's square (depending on how quick you walk) and the Rialto bridge is a walking distance too. About the hotel, the reception staff were very helpful and spoke very good English especially the manager, Marina and Laura was nice and sent us an email confirming our booking as soon as we booked the room and most importantly gave us the best map of Venice and showed us exactly where to go for tours and how to come back to the hotel on the map. The breakfast was continental but very nice, providing cheese,butter, different types of jam, tinned peaches, cereal, meusli, peach and orange juice, yoghurts, croissants, bread rolls and tea and coffee. One day they provided pie too. Our room was clean and spacious and it overlooked a very small stream or canal and it was very quiet. The TV was small and all the channels were Italian but it was no big deal as we came back late every night and we were too tired to watch TV. There are no tea or coffee facilities in the room but we asked for tea one night and the chap at reception prepared it for us free of charge. We booked for 3 tours from the hotel: the original walking tour, it was very nice where they showed us the important places in the city including St Marco, Rialto, Santa Maria Formosa, ....etc. but it is 2 hours and most of the time we were standing so you will need very good shoes and a good night's sleep too. The 2nd tour was the boat trip, where we were taken by a water taxi around the grand canal and they showed us the history behind some of the buildings and it was very nice too, different from the walking tour so I would recommend both. The 3rd tour was the Ghost walk in the evening that starts from the Rialto, it was nice and they took us to hidden places in the alleys (calle) and talked about people who died and stories about them. These were all booked from the hotel where they have brouchure's and you can choose any tour you want but alternatively you can go yourself to the starting point and book them yourself. They booked the trip to Murano for us and we went for that one again but because I read the previous reviews I knew exactly what to expect: They collected us from the hotel and took us there by water taxi and showed us the glass factory and it was very interesting to watch but afterwards we walked through the gallery or the display area and we enjoyed looking around. However, everything was very expensive and overpriced and when you finish walking around they lead you to the exit door and that's it! the trip is free GOING there but you have to go back on your own. If you wanted to take the Vaparotti back to San Marco when you go out of the exit TURN RIGHT and there is a vaparotti stop around the corner but if you want to look around in Murano there is a nice glass sculpture if you turn left and walk around the river or canal and small glass shops but we didn't buy anything because it was all quite expensive and we were advised to buy from Burano which we didn't have the time to go to! Maybe in our next visit. We bought 2 day tickets for the vaparotti (water bus) as recommended by others but there was something we noticed that no one mentioned before: although we had the tickets no one ever asked us for them! People seemed to go on the boats for free! Don't take my word for it but I am telling you nobody ever asked us for tickets neither there were any machines to check if they were valid! However, when we were going back from St Zaccaria stop we saw a woman asking people to show tickets and that was the only time it happened in the 3rd day of our stay. The trip to and from the airport was different, they asked for the tickets before you entered and half-way through which was 12 euros pp but it is a good hour to and from venice. If you are staying in Venice and you like the beach take a trip to Lido where they have nice beaches which are sandy. We didn't have any problems comminicating because it is a touristy area and most of the locals spoke English. I forgot to mention the gondola, you have to go on a gondola if you are in Venice! Expensive but absolutely worth it! Go after 8:00pm because it is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and spacious - great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: alandriel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Locandiera over the 3-5 May 2008 bank holiday weekend. I had found the hotel through recommendations at 'Venere' and tripadvisor then got in touch with them directly through La Locandiera's website as I had special considerations for my elderly mother. The reservation process was straight forward and very easy, the lady handling our booking was exceptionally helpful and with flawless English (and French as I later overheard). Upon arrival - thanks to the hotels excellent description and previously provided map - we found the place easily (sometimes a real feat in Venice !!) and promptly checked in. My mother and my daughter shared a triple as double use (arranged upon the hotels special recommendation) and me and my husband had a double opposite on the same floor. The rooms very very spacious, tastefully decorated and very clean, though a bit noisy at time sbut then that is to be expected from 1st floor accommodation. Breakfast was adequate in any respect for a 3 star hotel in the heart of Venice. All in all, the high praise that I've previously read about was justified and I can only recomment this property to anyone who needs a 'pied-a-terre' in Venice. Above all I'd like to praise the most excellent reception staff who were extremely helpful and knowledgeable in helping arrange anything from water taxis to fruit baskets and restaurant reservations. OUTSTANDING !

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Douglas49
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this wonderful hotel in April this year. The hotel was recommended in Rick Steve's Italy 2007 and I phoned from England to book our room. We needed two beds, which were provided, a queen and a single. The room was indeed charming and spacious with three beautiful windows overlooking a quiet square. I loved just opening the windows to hear the life of venice passing, for the most part quietly below. The Breakfast room was on the main floor and was a wonderful place to meet other travellers. The food was wonderful, with a wide selection of items, cereal, muesili, boiled eggs, fruit, fruit juice, coffee/tea etc etc. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful. I was concerned about the connections with the airport coach and how early I would need to leave to catch it. The front desk staff provided a detailed itinerary for catching the vaporetti and the coach which proved to be accurate and extremely helpful. My thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: jl1982
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel was fantastic just behind san marco square. The room was large and clean and price if booked direct with the hotel was very reasonable. The only things I'd flag as negatives: - There is a shower attachment in the bathroom, but no way of attaching it to the wall, so a shower is impossible - The breakfast was a little light on the ground, with no hot food available which I understand from other friends who have visited Venice is not the case in all hotels - The floors throughout the hotel are marble, and sound carries! Therefore as soon as breakfast started at 730am, we were woken on the 2nd floor! If you have your heart set on being in San Marco then this is a good place to go. If I was asked advice in the future, I'd recommend people stay out of San Marco as whilst its convenient around the main square, you'll pay double the price in any restaurant than if you head up from Rialto a bit

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonScott
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really great in terms of location. The welcome was exactly as described by other reviews - the staff were very welcoming and spoke fantastic english. The room was quite basic, but still lovely and spacious - we stayed in a family room for two people which overlooked the square. You did hear some noise first thing in the morning which was just the general hustle and bustle but it was a great way to wake up and to get going for a full on day of visiting the sites. The hotel is just a few minutes away from San Marcos and has some nice restaurants nearby although its worth getting to them early to avoid disappointment. overall i would definitely stay there again if i was in Venice although i might try somewhere on the Lido next time as i believe it's cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BankerABC
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in La Locandiera. Great location, just minutes away from St. Marks Square. Room was small like most Italian hotels but very nice. Little hard to find on my first trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel, well kept, quiet and close to St.Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: Pensylvania
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the week preceding Easter 2008. We had booked following recommendations in tripadviser and the hotel was fully up to expectations. We know that hotel keeping is a serious business in Italy but this one is a beauty. The room was clean and beautifully furnished, and the bathroom was a treat. The interior of the hotel was warm and well decorated and maintained in immaculate condition. The continental breakfast is fine for an early start on a day of sightseeing and the coffee alone will keep you buzzing all day. An excellent choice for a short city break in this case, and the staff were excellent, very helpful and informative and a credit to the establishment. Highly recommended by an experienced business traveller

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem! Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: skjames
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year old son and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. We took the Alilaguna water bus directly from the airport, which took 1 hr 10 mins to the San Zaccharia stop (around 12 euros per person each way; young children free). The hotel was easy to find when we followed the directions provided by the hotel (looking at street names rather than pictorially; around 5 minutes walk from San Zaccharia water bus station). It is located in a small, quiet square close to St Marks (2 minute walk), so although there are plenty of bars and restaurants close by, we had no problems with noise. The hotel itself is very clean, the room was very spacious (we had a large double bed, a single bed plus a cot in our room and there was still plenty of floor space). We booked a Family room, and just assumed it would include a bath - it didn't ( the shower cubicle was great though). So our toddler went unwashed for 3 days! As previous reviewers commented, the Breakfast is continental style with fresh croissants, bread, jams, boiled eggs, cereal, yogurts, tinned fruit, cheese, tea, coffee and juices. It was much better than we expected, and we all enjoyed waking up to the smell of freshly baked bread every day! One morning we went for a late breakfast, around 9.40am (breakfast was 8.00am-10.00am), and were disappointed to find all the eggs had gone and there was very little coffee left. On our final morning, however, the staff had arranged the breakfast early so we could eat before our departure. So that more than made up for the previous day! Staff are friendly and helpful. Venice itself is beautiful, although somewhat hard-work to navigate with a child's buggy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small and perfectly formed (almost)!”
Reviews.Author: gillygeegee
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have stated this is a great choice in Venice. Initially it was a little difficult to find as the map I obtained from the website I booked through did not accurately reflect the walkways and alleyways I had in front of me. If I recall correctly ... from the Grand Canal walk up Calle degli Albanesi or Calle delle Rasse - the latter was busier and wider (I think) then up Calle de Chiesa - first left after the square with restaurants and shops, just passed a pizza take away place - if you read the bridge across a waterway you have gone too far. The hotel is located on a very quiet square - there are some people walking through but few and far between as the square which the hotels stands on seems like a dead end - however, we found a little used back route from an alleyway in the square to St Marks which is less than 5 mins away - it is very difficult to describe how to get to places in Venice, but I would take good walking shoes and explore - I was with my mother and never felt threatend wherever we wondered after dark. I requested two single beds and we were allocated a room on the top floor (there is a small lift but not both of you and your luggage can squueze in) overlooking the square (no 5?)- yes not a room with a view but it was so peaceful and I know that noise is a common compliant in such a crowded city - it was large in comparison to other Enuropean cities we have stayed in with a double and a single bed - with plenty of room to walk around - a wardrobe, set of drawers, chair, small room safe - small haridryer, TV with only rolling news channels in ENlgish (but you have the most beautiful city on your doorstep) - there was a door into the room - with a very small area and a door to the good sized bathroom with shower and then another door to the sleeping area - this double door arrangement meant that I was never aware of noise from other guests. Breakfast on two mornings was served from the top floor - not the best breakfast in the world, dried foods, cerals and so on - but was good enough and set you up for the day. This hotel may not have a lot of mod cons, but it makes up for this in good value (in Venice), so clean / immaculate, location (close to St Marks, Waterbus stops, good value / good standard restaurants by Venice standards) and service from the wonderful friendly, helpful staff. Enjoy this hotel and the marvels of this city.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: VintageSuitcase
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at La Locandiera in Venice. The hotel is very clean, well-maintained and the staff's very friendly and they speak English. The location is ideal, close to the Vallareso and S. Zaccaria vaporetto/water taxi stops. It's also close to St. Mark's Square. It opens to a courtyard, it's a quiet area with the tolling of church bells to break the silence. There's an alley close by that has an internet cafe, shops and restaurants. Just a few tips: Make sure you have the exact directions to the hotel written down because it's very easy to get lost in Venice. Also, make sure to bring "waterproof shoes" (ex. not canvas) expecially during the rainy season because the Grand Canal overflows resulting in flooded streets or what the locals call "aqua alta".

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LAtravellers_7
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights/4 days at the lovely La Locandiera in late October/early November of 2007. It is located on a quiet side street so there is no noise at night, but it is very convenient to the Rialto, San Marco square, and the Grand canal. Marina, the manager, had terrific suggestions for dinner (Antica Secrestia was fabulous) and was just great overall. The breakfasts were just what we wanted. The room was neat as a pin, with a large bathroom and very comfortable bed. We left the windows open at night and slept like babies. Fortunately mosquitos are not a big problem in the fall in Venice. We arrived in the morning and left in early afternoon which was before check in and after check out, but they quickly offered to store our luggage until our room was ready, and until we were ready to leave for the train station. The only possible nit to pick would be that if you have long hair you may want to bring your own hair dryer and european outlet adapter. There was a blow dryer in the room but it was not very powerful. But that is a tiny nit and didn't detract at all from our enjoyment of this great hotel run by wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well-maintained small hotel in very quiet little square”
Reviews.Author: Ritchissimo
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Locandiera at the end of October. The hotel is not cheap, but reasonable by Venetian standards, very small, but very clean and well-maintained. Our family room was enormous with a modern, spotless bathroom. and views onto the Campo Giovanni Novo. Though the hotel only offers breakfast and doesn't have a restaurant, it is extremely well situated - a 5 minute walk to San Marco (tourist attractions) and Castello (excellent restaurants). It is located on a very quiet little Campo. The breakfast - though nothing fancy - is perfectly adequate and the multilingual receptionists are great: they made restaurant reservations for us, even hairdresser's - and didn't charge anything for the service - always very polite, friendly and helpful. The hotel (like others in Venice) offers a free water-taxi trip out to Murano to visit a glass factory. Enjoyed the visit thoroughly, didn't come under too much pressure to buy from the factory - though in fact we ended up buying a set of wineglasses. Though you have to get your own transport back to Venice (reasonably priced boat back), Murano is well worth the visit - very picturesque and beautiful. We had lunch there at the best restaurant (and we found many excellent restaurants in Venice) of our trip: the Busa alle Torre (Da Lele). Superb with the world's best tiramisu and soft-shelled fried crabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and plan on staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: BD08037
Reviews.Content: La Locandiera is a gem! This place was unbelievably clean. Just like all said, it is very close to San Marco. It's so close, but yet so quiet. Nice after a long day of walking. The staff was incredible! I forgot my itinerary at home and they went above and beyond to help me get it! I was shocked at the extent they went through to help me! Great people. When they recommend a place to eat, GO! I asked for a place that served beef and they recommended a local place. No one at the restaurant spoke english....who cares! It was the best steak that I have ever had!!!!! The breakfast that they served was really good. I loved the coffee! I'm already planning my next trip to Italy (including Venice) and thankfully I don't have to look for a hotel. La Locandiera is the place for me in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot”
Reviews.Author: fogmac
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here- a family of four- it was easy to find and was in a perfect location; quiet but close to all of the many interesting sights. We had a double room and they were clean, quiet and well appointed. Breakfast was good as was the help given by one of the staff who worked in reception- she was friendly and welcoming which makes all the difference for travellers. Our room looked over a canal and was serene.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: beer2go
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel was great. A bit hard to find, but once there you can always find your way back. Conveniently located near Piazza San Marco and the Doge's Palace, close to the Grand Canal. The room was spacious and overlooked a small canal. The staff was very helpful with some great dinner recommendations. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHe1975
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a quiet street within walking distance of St Marco's piazza. The room was quite big for Europeen standards and our room overlooked a small canal. The bathroom was very clean and and the bed was comfortable. At times because our room was on the 1st floor it was noisy some mornings because the staff was getting ready for breakfast. The location is outstanding within walking distances of many great restaurents and cafes. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Venice by San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Nalacalli
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Locandiera was a wonderful hotel. Staff was very helpful and it wasn't a long walk from the drop off point which was the San Marco stop. You wil have to cross over a bridge so hopefully the suitcases aren't that heavy. Room was very clean and it was air conditioned. Breakfast the next morning was the typical continental fare. Nothing exceptional but was good. Would recommend a stay at this hotel. We paid 120.00 Euro for a double room used as a single and 190.00 E for a triple room used as a twin (had two beds and a single). Not a bad price considering it was high season in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Retreat in Bustling Venice”
Reviews.Author: KayRuth
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, a quiet, peaceful square near enough to everything you want to see or do, including restaurants, major tourist destinations, gelato. When our room was without lights the first night we arrived, management offered a discount for that night. Breakfast room was very pleasant with croissants, rolls, fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, cheese, cereals, juice and good coffee. Rooms are extremely clean and comfortable. Front desk personnel were helpful, personable and professional. Would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: LoveGelati
Reviews.Content: The hotel/B&B is located in a quiet square just a few minutes away from St Mark's Square. The room and bathroom are very clean and spacious. Towels are also large and fluffy. Breakfast is standard but they do bake fresh bread every morning. The free Murano tour is free to go. HOwever, the prices are much more expensive inside the glass making showroom. You also have to pay for your trip back to Venice. All in all, this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Strigs8
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel on a quiet square just off St. Mark's square (read above). We had great service, a great room with a canal view and just a great stay. If I had to knock something, and this is only because I feel like I have to, the breakfast was a little weak compared to some of the others we had in Europe. But overall a fantastic stay and would do it again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: hatty07
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our 3 night stay from July 29 to August 1 2007 at this charming little hotel! It is tucked away in its' own little square adjacent to a church dating back to the 1300's. The location is fantastic (only a 5 min. walk from the hustle and bustle of St. Marks Square) A wonderful place to come back to after a long day of sight seeing! The staff is very helpful, making arrangements for tours and suggestions for restaurants. We had a double and a triple, which were both very, very clean, but simple. One room had a lovely view of the square below and the other overlooked the charming little canals behind the canal. The breakfast was plentiful(hard boiled eggs, croissants, cereal, rolls) We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: KrisPena
Reviews.Content: La Locandiera is a great small hotel in the heart of Venice. The location is great - between the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square - both within walking distance. It is on a quiet street with a canal in back. Breakfast was good - mostly breads, cereal, juice and some days also hard boiled eggs. Nothing like an American breakfast buffet but enough to get you started on your day! The staff was helpful in suggesting transportation, etc. Beds were comfy. Only a tub in our room (no stand up shower). Small fridge in the closet as well as a safe. Internet was about 9 euros for 30 minutes in your room or on their computer. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tissie
Reviews.Content: La Locandiera is a jewel. It is conviently located near St. Mark's square and a short walk from the water taxi. While the hotel reception is simple, the rooms are nicely decorated; very, very clean; and bathrooms are modern. We experienced the staff to be very helpful and accomodating -- in fact we had a medical problem and the staff did everything they possibly could to assist us. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel w/mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: LBToni
Reviews.Content: my partner and I just returned from Italy where we spent 2 nights at La Locanderia. The hotel is in a good location close to St. Mark's but in a quite neighborhood. The room was nicely decorated and very very clean. The bathroom was large but had only a tub with hand hold shower attachment. After much travel in Italy we were a bit suprised at how unfriendly the front desk clerk was. We were not greeted when we arrived, just take to our room. The same was true when we checked out, no "how was your stay" just run our credit card and be done with us. This was suprising after having just friendly Italian hosts and every other location we have traveled within Italy. The hotel was also noisy inside early in the morning while they were setting up breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venice”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a whole 7 nights stay at the La Locandiera. This little hotel is excellently positioned, only 3 minutes walk from my favourite place on earth, Saint Marks Square. If you are looking for a clean and comfortable budget hotel with very friendly staff, then look no further. Stay here as I can highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “happy to do it”
Reviews.Author: Puteaux
Reviews.Content: This was a charming, quiet, clean, welcoming small hotel set between a church square and a small canal, very easy to find, 7 minutes walk from St Marks, and two minutes form a delightful square with a couple of cafe-restaurants. Our bedroom was spacious, nicely furnished in typical Venetian care, our bed was king size and very comfortable. The shower room was immaculate with plenty of good quality white towels. we were pleased too with the little safe tucked away in a cupboard for our use. There was a lift. Breakfast was in a room set aside for it and was of simple buffet style and suited us well. The staff were at all times helpful and caring of our needs. They spoke good English and booked our water taxi for us; it dropped us a few minutes away which was very useful. We really cannot fault La Locantiera and would recommend it to anyone as a perfect situation. We have just spent three days there in celebration of our 50th wedding anniversary, and were utterly delighted with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: Coz-7
Reviews.Content: La Locandiera was a fantastic choice, I took recommendations from Trip Advisors and was extremely pleased with this hotel. The staff were friendly, and around 24-7, the room was fantastic!!! We had a room on the first room at the back of the hotel, overlooking a lovely canal (beware of the mosquitos)! This room was very noisy, but it didn't dampen our spirits... The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk to San Marco Square, you are surrounded by cafes, restaurants and bars... I would recommend this trip and this hotel to anyone who wants to truely explore this city!!!!! I would definately recommend taking the boat trip to Lido, lots more to see and do, and hiring a bicycle is a excellent way to get about!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SDedalus
Reviews.Content: On my seventh trip to Venice (in April 2007), I finally found the perfect hotel. I'd booked it because it had the highest customer satisfaction rating (9.1) of any 3-star hotel on venere.com, & it is well deserved. You will never find a quieter hotel in Venice or one so perfectly located & so tastefully appointed for the price. Cordial staff. Lovely rooms. Great bathrooms. Standard breakfast buffet for this category & price range. Having stayed there, I find the few niggling negative comments in the traveler reviews to be rather silly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: 1234myfntc
Reviews.Content: First let me start with the most gracious "coinceirge", I have ever met. She is a lady from Croatia and I can't say enough about her graciousness and her desire to help. The room was not large but certainly adequat for one person. It was all in marble and very very very clean. The hotel is a small charming place walkalbe to St Marcus square and virtually everywhere else. It is tucked in a small square right next to one of the canals. And the rates were more that generous considering the wonderfull service and accomadations. I whole heartly recommend this hotel and hopefully I will be able to return their again on my way to Coratia.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: jbaloo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is generally very clean and nice. The only issue we had, which I felt was a big one, was that our room had a trail of ants in the bedroom and bathroom. They were small ants that probably wouldn't have harmed us but we did not like the fact of sleeping with ants or having them crawl on our things. At first we asked them to clean up the ants and spray the source of where they are coming from but after coming back several hours later, nothing was done. We then asked to switch rooms but they said none were available. I wanted to switch hotels because I couldn't stand the fact of sleeping with ants but they would not allow us to cancel without having to pay the first night's rate. So my husband asked for Raid and ant spray and we had to kill the ones in our room and find the source of the problem and he was able to stop them from crawling around for the rest of the night. I was really upset because 1) nothing was done when we first asked them to clean up the ants (and it wasn't hard to fix) and 2) they would not allow us to cancel without a fee due to the hotel's unwillingness and inflexibility But in the end, we tried not to let this bother us and ruin our trip. After all, we were in one of the most beautiful cities in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pizzasready
Reviews.Content: La Locandiera is a lovely and charming hotel close to St Mark's Square but in a very quiet location. We stayed three nights and left only this morning - it was so good I just had to write this as soon as I got home! It is situated very handily for a number of restaurants and bars should you not want to walk too far at night time. The staff are really friendly and helpful, and always smiling. When we go back to Venice we WILL stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Locandiera”
Reviews.Author: Mulherin
Reviews.Content: Having just left the appalling Hotel Marconi after one night, we arrived at the Locandiera wondering why we had come to Venice. It did not take long for our spirits to rise with the help of the wonderful staff . Nothing was too much trouble. Great quiet location - but only a short walk to main sights. Spacious and light rooms. We would definitely stay there again. If only I had been aware of The Trip Advisor site last year - we could have gone there in the first place.

HotelInfo.Name: La Locandiera
HotelInfo.Address: Campo San Giovanni Nuovo 4432, 30122 Venice, Italy
